## Description
This course introduces students to the principles and practices of **Population Data Science**, an emerging interdisciplinary field combining **demography, statistics, and computational methods** to analyze population data.

---

## Learning Objectives
By the end of this course, students will be able to:
1. Understand key population data sources and their limitations  
2. Apply R for demographic and spatial data analysis  
3. Build reproducible workflows using open science tools (R, Quarto, GitHub)  
4. Conduct a mini population data project
